column5: Occurs in: V + 곤 하다 and V + 곤 했다 talk about habits of the present and past respectively
turns an adjective into an adverb (https://www.koreanwikiproject.com/wiki/A_+_게), "so that": https://www.howtostudykorean.com/unit-3-intermediate-korean-grammar/unit-3-lessons-51-58/lesson-56/

clause connector (https://www.howtostudykorean.com/unit-3-intermediate-korean-grammar/lessons-67-75/lesson-70/). also table in https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%EC%9E%88%EB%8B%A4#Conjugation Cause/Reason marker

column1: # ef: Final ending marker. SLOTS: V, VI, VII

column5: The 읍 part is Slot IV.
https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/라 lists various such suffixes: Imperative; that sb should; that; because. SLOT VI
The ㅂ part is SLOT IV.
cause/reason connective form, formal polite (table in https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%EC%9E%88%EB%8B%A4#Conjugation)

interrogative formal polite (table in https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%EC%9E%88%EB%8B%A4#Conjugation). Actually composed of seumni-kka where seumni marks Formal Polite (compare -seumnida for indicative Formal Polite). The 까 ending is in SLOT VI. The 습 ending is SLOT IV.
The ㅂ part is SLOT IV.
The ㅂ part is SLOT IV.
The ㅂ part is SLOT IV.
Polite suffix (SLOT VII). Also labeled jxf.
The ㅂ part is SLOT IV.
indicative formal polite (table in https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%EC%9E%88%EB%8B%A4#Conjugation). The 습 part belongs to SLOT IV.
Like 습니다. The initial ㅂ part (SLOT IV) is an allomorph of 습.

column1: # Pre-final ending marker. SLOTS II, III, V

column5: honorific suffix (SLOT II). There is also a subjunctive -si/-s (SLOT V).
Polite suffix (SLOT VII). Also labeled ef.
as a verb, this means 'to do'
as a verb, this means 'to become'
